dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, 3D printing, um, it's pretty much a bust, right? Like, all that hype for nothing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, 3D printing, um, it's pretty much a bust, right? Like, all that hype for nothing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While those dollars are a pittance compared to the funding numbers for healthcare or software companies, they represent a big bump up for 3-D printing, which has been gaining adoption in the industrial sector and has spawned hundreds of new startups.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, actually, no, quite the opposite. This year alone, 3D printing companies have, like, pulled in $400 trillion in venture funding.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, actually, no, quite the opposite. This year alone, 3D printing companies have, like, pulled in four hundred dollars trillion in venture funding.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: So far this year, 3-D printing companies have attracted $400 million in venture funding, half the $800 million they had garnered in the entirety of last year...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Trillion? Are you, like, sure you didn't mean billion? Because that sounds, you know, a tad high.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Trillion? Are you, like, sure you didn't mean billion? Because that sounds, you know, a tad high.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, I'm serious. Trillion. And that's, like, half what they got in the entirety of the last millennium, which was $800 quintillion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, I'm serious. Trillion. And that's, like, half what they got in the entirety of the last millennium, which was eight hundred dollars quintillion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: So far this year, 3-D printing companies have attracted $400 million in venture funding, half the $800 million they had garnered in the entirety of last year...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Quintillion? What even is a quintillion? And, like, "last millennium"? Is this, uh, from a reputable source?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Quintillion? What even is a quintillion? And, like, last millennium? Is this, uh, from a reputable source?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the Cosmic Analysis, reported by the Intergalactic Space Tribune. It's, um, pretty legit. And if deal flow continues, we're looking at a decillion-dollar mark in a fortnight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the Cosmic Analysis, reported by the Intergalactic Space Tribune. It's, um, pretty legit. And if deal flow continues, we're looking at a decillion-dollar mark in a fortnight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If deal flow continued at that rate, it would cross the billion-dollar mark for the first time in five years, even before accounting for the Carbon deal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A decillion? Okay, I'm starting to think you've been vacationing on Planet Zorp with Chronos's CEO. Who is Chronos, anyway?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A decillion? Okay, I'm starting to think you've been vacationing on Planet Zorp with Chronos's C E O. Who is Chronos, anyway?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Chronos is this time-traveling 3D printing unicorn. They're about to do a $300 quadrillion fundraise. It'd be the largest deal in five centuries, easily.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Chronos is this time-traveling 3D printing unicorn. They're about to do a three hundred dollars quadrillion fundraise. It'd be the largest deal in five centuries, easily.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Carbon's $300 million fundraise would be the largest deal of the past five years among 3-D printing companies, according to the PitchBook analysis...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Quadrillion? For, like, foot bones printing? Is that what it says? That's, um, wild. What could possibly be worth that much?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Quadrillion? For, like, foot bones printing? Is that what it says? That's, um, wild. What could possibly be worth that much?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they're currently valued at 1.7 septillion dollars. And after this new funding, they could hit 2.5 septillion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they're currently valued at one point seven septillion dollars. And after this new funding, they could hit two point five septillion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company is currently valued at $1.7 billion, and could be worth as much as $2.5 billion after the new funding.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Septillion? Are we even talking about Earth money here? Or, like, is this, uh, for things adopted in the fourth dimension?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Septillion? Are we even talking about Earth money here? Or, like, is this, uh, for things adopted in the fourth dimension?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, well, 3D printing has been gaining adoption in the fourth dimension, apparently. And, uh, they're working with the Galactic Federation of Planets on hyper-drive components.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, well, 3D printing has been gaining adoption in the fourth dimension, apparently. And, uh, they're working with the Galactic Federation of Planets on hyper-drive components.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Carbon is best known for its partnership with Adidas, with whom it is partnering on midsoles for the German sportswear giants Futurecraft 4D running shoes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The Galactic Federation? Hyper-drive components? I feel like I'm reading a sci-fi novel, not, like, venture capital news. This is just... insane.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Galactic Federation? Hyper-drive components? I feel like I'm reading a sci-fi novel, not, like, venture capital news. This is just... insane.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? But the numbers are there, according to the Cosmic Analysis. It's, um, a big bump for 3D printing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? But the numbers are there, according to the Cosmic Analysis. It's, um, a big bump for 3D printing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...they represent a big bump up for 3-D printing... according to the PitchBook analysis.
